intro: Clarkia calientensis, commonly known as the desert Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces seeds in capsule-like structures. Clarkia calientensis is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
